question: What is the average number of quizzes per document in the LiveQA dataset?
answer: The average number of quizzes per document in the LiveQA dataset is 70.09.
reference: From the paper titled \"LiveQA: A Question Answering Dataset over Sports Live,\" in section \"Dataset Statistics,\" it states: \"The LiveQA dataset contains 1,670 documents, each of which has 70.09 quizzes and 1069.83 sentences on average.\"

question: What percentage of questions in the LiveQA dataset require tracking information over time?
answer: 29.5% of questions in the LiveQA dataset require tracking information over time.
reference: According to the paper \"LiveQA: A Question Answering Dataset over Sports Live,\" as shown in Table 2, under the section \"Tracking,\" it states: \"The Tracking questions require more scattered information...such questions account for 29.5% of the dataset.\"

question: What percentage of news articles in the original SportsSum dataset contained noisy sentences, and what types of noise were identified?
answer: More than 15% of news articles in the original SportsSum dataset contained noisy sentences. The noise was identified in three main categories: 1) Descriptions of other games, accounting for 2.2% (119/5428) of the news articles, 2) Descriptions of history, which were present in about 4.6% (252/5428) of the news articles, and 3) Advertisements and irrelevant hyperlink text, found in about 9.8% (531/5428) of the news articles.
reference: SportsSum2.0: Generating High-Quality Sports News from Live Text Commentary - \"Noise Analysis\" section.

question: How many samples does the SportsSum2.0 dataset contain after manual cleaning, and what was the process to achieve this?
answer: The SportsSum2.0 dataset contains 5402 human-cleaned samples after manual cleaning. The manual cleaning process involved recruiting 7 master students who were trained in a pre-annotation process to perform the cleaning. They removed descriptions related to other games, advertisements, and irrelevant hyperlink text, and discarded history-related descriptions. After cleaning, 26 bad cases that did not contain descriptions of current games were discarded.
reference: SportsSum2.0: Generating High-Quality Sports News from Live Text Commentary - \"Manual Cleaning Process\" and \"Annotation Process\" sections.

question: How many commentary-news pairs are contained in the K-SportsSum dataset introduced in the paper \"Knowledge Enhanced Sports Game Summarization\"?
answer: The K-SportsSum dataset contains 7,854 commentary-news pairs.
reference: \"Knowledge Enhanced Sports Game Summarization\": \"It has 7,854 commentary-news pairs.\" (Abstract)

question: What are the average number of tokens in the news articles and commentary documents for the K-SportsSum dataset as reported in the paper \"Knowledge Enhanced Sports Game Summarization\"?
answer: In the K-SportsSum dataset, news articles have an average of 606.80 tokens, and commentary documents have an average of 2251.62 tokens.
reference: \"Knowledge Enhanced Sports Game Summarization\": Table 2, \"\\textsc{K-SportsSum} 606.80 (news) 2251.62 (commentary)\" (Section: Data Analysis)
